description: Deletes the input source and all of its imported resources from the Resilience Hub application.

parameters.name: appArn
parameters.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Resilience Hub application. The format for this ARN is: arn: partition:resiliencehub: region: account:app/ app-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Used for an idempotency token. A client token is a unique, case-sensitive string of up to 64 ASCII characters. You should not reuse the same client token for other API requests. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: eksSourceClusterNamespace
parameters.description: The namespace on your Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster that you want to delete from the Resilience Hub application. Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster. The format for this ARN is: arn: aws:eks: region: account-id:cluster/ cluster-name. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide. Name of the namespace that is located on your Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster.

nested_params.name: eksClusterArn
nested_params.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster. The format for this ARN is: arn: aws:eks: region: account-id:cluster/ cluster-name. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide.

nested_params.name: namespace
nested_params.description: Name of the namespace that is located on your Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster.

parameters.name: terraformSource
parameters.description: The imported Terraform s3 state ï¬le you want to remove from the Resilience Hub application. The URL of the Terraform s3 state file you need to import.

nested_params.name: s3StateFileUrl
nested_params.description: The URL of the Terraform s3 state file you need to import.

nested_items.name: appArn
nested_items.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Resilience Hub application. The format for this ARN is: arn: partition:resiliencehub: region: account:app/ app-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide.

nested_items.name: appInputSource
nested_items.description: Name of the input source from where the application resource is imported from.

nested_items.name: eksSourceClusterNamespace
nested_items.description: The namespace on your Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster.

nested_items.name: eksClusterArn
nested_items.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster. The format for this ARN is: arn: aws:eks: region: account-id:cluster/ cluster-name. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide.

nested_items.name: namespace
nested_items.description: Name of the namespace that is located on your Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service cluster.

nested_items.name: importType
nested_items.description: The resource type of the input source.

nested_items.name: sourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the input source. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide.

nested_items.name: sourceName
nested_items.description: The name of the input source.

nested_items.name: terraformSource
nested_items.description: The name of the Terraform s3 state ï¬le.

nested_items.name: s3StateFileUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the Terraform s3 state file you need to import.
